Notes: Joint RAF/FAA platform with AN/APG-81 AESA radar (200+ km detection), sensor fusion, and internal 4-6 Meteor/AIM-120D bays for stealthy BVR; MADL datalink enables cooperative kills via E-7 cueing to 200 km envelope; 48 total delivered by end-2025, with 39 operational across 617/207 Sqn (RAF) and 809 NAS (FAA).

Tranche 2/3 backbone with CAPTOR-E AESA (250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 6-8 Meteor missiles for high-Pk BVR; integrates with Link-16 for NATO ops; Tranche 1 retirement ongoing (26 active, Falklands-based to 2027), total fleet ~120 pre-retirements but 102 combat-coded post-2025 adjustments.

E-3 replacement with MESA AESA radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course Meteor updates; full operational capability achieved 2025 with No. 8 Sqn; reduced from 5 to 3, but 2025 defence review eyes additions for persistent BVR coverage.

ELINT platform with River Joint suite for enemy radar/missile cueing, suppressing threats to enable Typhoon/F-35 salvos; No. 51 Sqn ops integrate via Link-16; all 3 delivered and upgraded by 2025 for GPS-denied environments.

Upgraded Global 6000 with Litening pods and SAR/GMTI radar for persistent targeting (200 km range); supports BVR via datalink fusion; fleet expanded to 9 but 8 operational by 2025, OSD 2030 pending Protector transition.
Retained Global Express-based with ASaC radar (300 km) for cueing despite E-7 arrival; No. 5 Sqn provides gap-filler for networked BVR; upgrades extended service to 2025+ amid delays in replacements.
MRTT with boom/probe refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-35/Typhoon; No. 10/101 Sqn ops; full fleet operational, enabling carrier strike group sustainment with Queen Elizabeth-class.

Persistent UAS with Lynx SAR (50 km) and Hellfire/GBU-12 for attritable BVR support; No. 13/39 Sqn transitioning to Protector RG1 (10 delivered by Nov 2025); integrates datalinks for cueing manned assets in contested airspace.
